Project Proposal

I have a personal project I have been working on called LolFantasy. It is an andoid app for a fantasy league of the video game League of Legends. Build a team of players and compete with your friends to see whos team is the best. Each week, players will get awarded points based on their performace. The team with the most points wins that week.

About the Project

To make this happen, I'm hosting it on an AWS EC2 t2.mirco machine running Ubuntu. As I do not anticipate much traffic on it and the requests are not computaionally heavy, 1 vCPU and 1gb of RAM should be more than enough to host the server.

The machine will be running 3 things. A static webserver, a ASP.NET API webserver and a database.

The website will have a link to the andriod app to download. The ASP.NET webserver will communicate with a MySQL database using the EntityFramework library and will store user information on the players users have, what they scored for the specific week etc.. In other words, it will handle the CRUD operations for the app. The app itself will be an Android app that uses Jetpack Compose for the UI elements and KTOR for the communication elements.

I admittedly have probably bitten off more than I can chew for this project. Though I will work towards my goal and hopefully still complete it, I don't know if I will have a polished product ready by the end of the semester. I will endevour to have at least a working proof of concept with only one user that I can edit the team of and have the score count up for each week.

About Licencing

All of the frameworks, libraries and services I will be using are all open-source.

  • Nginx
  • Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022
  • Andriod Studio
  • ASP.NET Core
  • Jetpack Compose
  • KTOR
  • Entity Framework
  • MySQL

I am just using these to create my own product/service, so for the purposes of my project I do not need to abide by any copyright or copyleft and am able to freely set the licencing for this project as I wish. So I am choosing to make the licencing for this project copyleft. Specifically, I wish this project to be under creative commons licencing, CC-BY-NC.
